title: Training hangs without error (Ubuntu 20.04, CUDA 11.2, cuDNN 8.1, driver 460)
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

While running the script described in "steps to reproduce," training will either hang immediately or complete several (usually 2-11) iterations in rapid succession and then hang (won't close the program though). GPU utility drops to zero while memory usage remains high.

Expected behavior: training will either continue or an error will be thrown explaining why training can't proceed.

### Operating System

Ubuntu 20.04 LTS

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version 2.2.0.6

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu

### Steps To Reproduce

```{python}
from pathlib import Path

import os

#create a training dataset
deeplabcut.create_training_dataset(path_config_file)

#start training
deeplabcut.train_network(path_config_file, allow_growth=True, displayiters=1)
```

This issue is reminiscent of #536 but not in Windows and terminating much earlier.
